ast.name: ap-work-microservice
ast.description:
The Work microservice manages work done by the community. 
Work is a general term but currently only represents the `app-project` type. Support
for other work types will be added in the future.

Work objects can also be hierarchical via the use of the `parentId` field.

resources.name: Work Management
resources.description:
All requests are constrained to the user making the request unless otherwise noted.

Work objects have the following common fields:

+ `name`: text string used as a label for the object

+ `parentId`: an optional field used to indicate the parent work object's id

+ `modelType`: specifies the type of work object (currently only "app-project")

**App Project**

An app project is a type of work object that is used to manage work to be done by the
community in order to build an application. 
An app project contains the following app project-specific fields:

+ `summary`: text summary of the project

+ `requestType`: what type of work is being requested

+ `competitorApps`: an array of strings representing names of competitor apps that should be used as a reference

+ `usageDescription`: an description of how the app will be used

+ `features`: an object that has the following attributes
    + `name`: the name of the feature
    + `description`: a description of the feature
    + `explanation`: an explanation of the feature
    + `custom`: whether this is a custom feature or not

+ `status`: indicates the overall status of the project

+ `statusNotes`: can be used to provide more detail about the current status

+ `copilotId`: the user id of the co-pilot assigned to the project

+ `quotedAmount`: a string representing the price of the project

+ `price`: a decimal representing the price of the project

+ `priceCurrency`: the ISO 4217 currency code for the price of the project

+ `tcDirectId`: the id of the topcoder Direct project id that corresponds to the project

actions.name: Create Work
actions.description: Creates a new work object. The type of work object is specified with the `modelType` field.

actions.name: Update Work
actions.description: Updates an existing work object. The requester must be the owner of the work object.

parameters.name: workId
parameters.description: the id of the work object

parameters.name: workId
parameters.description: the id of the work object

actions.name: Query Work
actions.description:
Queries for work objects. NOTE: the `filter` parameter value must be URL encoded since it
is a URL parameter.

Some useful queries:

+ Find all root app-projects (modelType = app-project AND parentId = "none"): `modelType%3Dapp-project%26parentId%3Dnone` 

    *note the value `none` is used to indicate no parent*

+ Find all children of a given object (parentId = \<id\>): `parentId%3D1427467702614:c6c56d74-b6c4-427d-88a3-47bf8dd9fe56`

actions.name: Retrieve work events
actions.description:
Retrieves an event timeline for a work object. 
Currently events are generated only for `app-project` work objects.

A work event has the following attributes:

+ `workId`: Id of the work object the events are associated with

+ `eventType`: Currently the only type is `timeline`

+ `eventSubType`: a sub-categorization of the type of event.

+ `sourceObjectType`: the type of object contained in the `sourceObjectContent` attribute. The current types are `app-project` and `challengedata`

+ `sourceObjectContent`: the object is an `app-project` or `challengedata`


**challengedata**

A challengedata object contains information about a challenge state transition. It
has the following attributes:

+ `challengeId`: Id of the topcoder challenge

+ `tcDirectId`: Id of the topcoder Direct project associated with the challenge

+ `phase`: The phase that the challenge is transitioning **from**. Current values are `Registration` and `Submission`

+ `registrants`: An array of objects with a `handle` attribute. The handle is the topcoder user handle

+ `submissions`: An array of objects with a `submissionId` attribute. The submissionId is the id of the topcoder submission

parameters.name: workId
parameters.description: the id of the work object

content.name: Work Management
content.description:
All requests are constrained to the user making the request unless otherwise noted.

Work objects have the following common fields:

+ `name`: text string used as a label for the object

+ `parentId`: an optional field used to indicate the parent work object's id

+ `modelType`: specifies the type of work object (currently only "app-project")

**App Project**

An app project is a type of work object that is used to manage work to be done by the
community in order to build an application. 
An app project contains the following app project-specific fields:

+ `summary`: text summary of the project

+ `requestType`: what type of work is being requested

+ `competitorApps`: an array of strings representing names of competitor apps that should be used as a reference

+ `usageDescription`: an description of how the app will be used

+ `features`: an object that has the following attributes
    + `name`: the name of the feature
    + `description`: a description of the feature
    + `explanation`: an explanation of the feature
    + `custom`: whether this is a custom feature or not

+ `status`: indicates the overall status of the project

+ `statusNotes`: can be used to provide more detail about the current status

+ `copilotId`: the user id of the co-pilot assigned to the project

+ `quotedAmount`: a string representing the price of the project

+ `price`: a decimal representing the price of the project

+ `priceCurrency`: the ISO 4217 currency code for the price of the project

+ `tcDirectId`: the id of the topcoder Direct project id that corresponds to the project

actions.name: Create Work
actions.description: Creates a new work object. The type of work object is specified with the `modelType` field.

actions.name: Update Work
actions.description: Updates an existing work object. The requester must be the owner of the work object.

parameters.name: workId
parameters.description: the id of the work object

actions.description:

is a URL parameter.

Some useful queries:

+ Find all root app-projects (modelType = app-project AND parentId = "none"): `modelType%3Dapp-project%26parentId%3Dnone` 

    *note the value `none` is used to indicate no parent*

+ Find all children of a given object (parentId = \<id\>): `parentId%3D1427467702614:c6c56d74-b6c4-427d-88a3-47bf8dd9fe56`

actions.name: Retrieve work events
actions.description:
Retrieves an event timeline for a work object. 
Currently events are generated only for `app-project` work objects.

A work event has the following attributes:

+ `workId`: Id of the work object the events are associated with

+ `eventType`: Currently the only type is `timeline`

+ `eventSubType`: a sub-categorization of the type of event.

+ `sourceObjectType`: the type of object contained in the `sourceObjectContent` attribute. The current types are `app-project` and `challengedata`

+ `sourceObjectContent`: the object is an `app-project` or `challengedata`


**challengedata**

A challengedata object contains information about a challenge state transition. It
has the following attributes:

+ `challengeId`: Id of the topcoder challenge

+ `tcDirectId`: Id of the topcoder Direct project associated with the challenge

+ `phase`: The phase that the challenge is transitioning **from**. Current values are `Registration` and `Submission`

+ `registrants`: An array of objects with a `handle` attribute. The handle is the topcoder user handle

+ `submissions`: An array of objects with a `submissionId` attribute. The submissionId is the id of the topcoder submission

parameters.name: workId
parameters.description: the id of the work object
